Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but too far out of town for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: yumyum5
Reviews.Content: Lovely decorated and good sized room, but too far out of town when only visiting Barcelona for a few nights. Don't expect a lively area, as this is a new residential area. However, there is a metro close to the hotel that will take you into town in about 15 min. The hotel staff was friendly and the rooms were spotless. One more con: our AC didn't work properly and therefore the room (416) was too hot (in summer it wouldn't be bearable).

Reviews.Title: “Not too good so far”
Reviews.Author: countryclaire
Reviews.Content: We arrived last night, staff are ver friendly and helpful and rooms clean but we have a few problems. Our room was really hit last night, the air conditioning seems poor. We bought the expensive wi-fi for the room and did not work. The hotel are not going to charge us for it. We are on the first floor and it was really noisy. Today we will tell the hotel and see how they respond. If they respond well I will revise this review

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandIzzy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first ever trip to Barcelona. The hotel is very modern, all public areas and the rooms very clean and fresh, staff efficient although not smiley and chatty!! We did not eat in hotel but used the bar on our last night - service good but we were the only customers!! not knowing any better when we booked and not wanting something too central, only found out on arrival how far in walking distance the hotel is from centre of city. But it is a quiet, residential/business area and of course the transport links are fantastic - Metro station 5 mins away, 'tram' stops and bus stops 2 minutes from front door and train station not far either. Barcelona is a fantastic city and if you are prepared to be out of the centre, this really is excellent value, Downsides - no pool, a decking area which is usually mostly in shade later in day and no balconies in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room, beware of any extra charges.”
Reviews.Author: anacri
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in a quiet part of Barcelona, two blocks from the Metro station and one of the main highways. It's close to the beach, but I didn't go there because it was too cold and I live by a beach, so I had very little interest in that part. The room was spacious for European standards. The king size bed was a real one, not two twins put together, like many during our trip. The staff was friendly enough. The only real drawback is that even though the room was reasonably priced, everything else was not. Internet access was priced at half of what we paid for the room. Breakfast was highway robbery. Fortunately, there are plenty of places in Barcelona to find both breakfast and internet access. I would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “i would recommended it!”
Reviews.Author: John X
Reviews.Content: +an excellent hotel!The photos show the reality.The room was fantastic,big,clean,with nice view.The room has refrigerator,safe box,hair dryer.The neighborhood is quite,with lot of parks and you feel safe to walk even at midnight.Don't miss to see the Rabla de Pomplenou. The metro station is 2 minutes away and you can reach the city center(Jaume I) in ten minutes or Passeig de Cracia at 15 minutes. Hot water and very good service.Good price for value. - The bed was very hard for me.

Reviews.Title: “What a service!!”
Reviews.Author: Ola_r1989
Reviews.Content: We arrived there on the 12/3 and departed on 15/3. We had nothing but chorus of praises for the hotel staffs for their friendliness and politeness. The hotel is 7 minutes walk to the sea side and 8 minutes walk to the Diagonal Mar shopping complex. There were also a few restaurants and cafe's serving tapas. We had no issue with the cleanliness and the quiet area, left us with good rest and sleep. Resonable price and good room service too!! The only downside is that we wished the wi-fi was free... :( Other than that, no problems what-so-ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in Diagonal Mar area”
Reviews.Author: Rishiraj_s
Reviews.Content: Small decent hotel in diagonal mar area. Selva De Mar Metro is approx 100m and the shopping mall diagonal mar is probably 150m .... Mar Bella Beach is a 10 mins walk from the hotel .... I was in barcelona for MWC .. so still 20 mins by Metro to Fira from this hotel and at times of MWC all hotels jack up their price so cant really complain. Breakfast is quite limited, internet is free only in the lobby thru Wi-Fi, they charge for net in the room. Rooms are comfortable and cozy with about everything there ..... Choose it if u need to be closer to the beach. Center is 20 mins by metro. Staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A short weekend but unforgetable weekend in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Ripper38
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take our daughter to Barcelona for the weekend and we booked into the Hotel Vincci Maritimo. I have to say what tipped the balance was that I had to read 4 pages of reviews before reading any criticisms and even then I found them constructive and I have to say we were very happy with the choice. Generally speaking if there is any criticism its about actually getting to the hotel. If you are going by car, as we did, you really need GPS. The last 2 kilometres from the B-10/Rondo literal bypass exit was very hectic. The traffic is one-way so if you miss the turning to loop back round to approach the hotel you will find yourself heading along the Ave Diagonal into the city centre if you are not careful. Anyway we got there in the end. Now onto the hotel itself. The hotel is 4* and merits them 1- The reception staff were professional AND friendly, plus they even asked us our choice of bed (Big or Twins?) so 01st Brownie point 2- The rooms were big, with A/C, stylish - we liked the design - complete with courtesy products and literature and were clean...plus the mini-bar was full and not with the usual courtesy bottle of water, so 02nd brownie point 3- The beds were nice and big, a bit hard after a days driving but thats no big deal 4- The bathroom was spacious and well equipped (the only minus point was the glass partition between the shower and the wash basin was a bit too small, plus the bottom of the bath tub was slippery) 5- Breakfast was nice , complete with Spanish /regional specialties, but at 18euros if booking with special rates don't forget to include breakfast, its worth it. 6- Other restaurant. Had evening drinks and Tapas, which the wife and daughter loved. = Conclusion. Overall evaluation is very good and would definitely go there again. Next time if we go by car we know how to get there, and once there we will definitely use the Public transport system to get around the city, there's a Metro and Tram stop not far away at "Selva de Mar" and we do advise visitors to use it, its easy, clean and safe, as safe as any Metro system in the world can be, but be street wise. Final word. Even if you don't speak Spanish the Hotel staff speak English but at least learn how to say "Please" & "thank you" in Spanish and SMILE you'll appreciate it in return!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ka T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not too close to the center, but metro is not far from hotel. It's good to stay here in summer because they have beach right outside the hotel, however we were there in winter so for us it didn't do anything. The hotel itself looks fancy, rooms very modern but small, staff is very helpful and friendly. The cons is the noise I guess in Europe all hotels have thin walls, you can hear people in rooms very clearly so bring ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: sanddiver44
Reviews.Content: I thought I was taking a chance by staying at the Vincci Maritimo because of the other reviews I had read....I wasn't. If you are looking for a party central type location, this isn't it. If you are looking for a quiet hotel within a three minute walk of the beach and two minutes from the subway then look no further. The room was spacious and clean and allowed me to sleep all night long. There are more than a few places to have breakfast within a block or so and the large mall four minutes walk away had a huge selection of local eating venues. I never spent more than twenty minutes on the subway and had a great vacation in large part to the central location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good only for participating in congresses”
Reviews.Author: lescol
Reviews.Content: I would mark this hotel as good for business and visiting Barselona Conventional Center - this hotel has good location only for this reason. And for shopping in shoping mall which is close to the Congress hall. Nothing else close this hotel: no nightlife near this hotel, no sightseeing, no real Barselona atmosphere is available here. Generally hotel is OK, has modern style but looks cold and a bit cheap. Really I would better stay in more stylish and welcoming place that this hotel. Please stay in Vincci Maritimo without any doubt if you will stay just one night, if longer - take your time for finding smth better!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but outside city center”
Reviews.Author: nomz33
Reviews.Content: Due to airline cancellations, our tour company had to change our hotel to the Vincci. It is a nice hotel with friendly staff, clean rooms and a restaurant to eat. They have a good breakfast buffet in the morning. The location is outside the main city center, but it is close to the metro. If you like a quiet hotel outside the main city then this is a great place to stay. If you want to be closer to things to do then it is not the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Protagonist
Reviews.Content: close to conference center, shopping mall and subway, this is nice hotel for both business and private stay. poor internet access (paid!).

Reviews.Title: “MY FAVOURITE”
Reviews.Author: MilanMarco
Reviews.Content: Honestly this is one of the best money for value hotel i have ever been...I have been twice with my Spanish girlfriend and I was very well impressed both times. I have been (as you can see in other review) tons of times to Barcelona so I can be very selective with this city...Nice building , nice rooms, courteous staff and a good breakfast... About the position...If you want to be very close to the center this is not for you. the hotel is 100 mt from Selva de Mar train station but every time you have to change metro to reach Catalunya and the Rambla area (for what it's worth in these days...) so you spend little bit time and in the evening you have to be careful with the time. Not use taxi, expensive from the center. If you want to go to the sea, well...you can see it from your room..you just have to go toward south and in 200 mt you reach it, Nova Icarria, Mar Bella.. The area is not busy at night but you can have dinner next to sea or to the mall in the Diagonal, very close to the hotel. Prices...you have to book early because the hotel is not cheap but is on demand and if you book late you pay the price... I recommend to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: BKDOT
Reviews.Content: Whilst the receptionist was very very nice and the stay started well, I would not recommend this hotel. Too far from Barcelona centre for our liking plus the restaurant did not open in the evening until 8.30 which was too late for us. The food in the restaurant is poor and the service in the restaurant and the bar is just not good enough. The hotel is clean and the rooms are good but ......

Reviews.Title: “Good but no-one around”
Reviews.Author: Sighle
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, good location and well-maintained hotel with parking. Reception staff pleasant . But there was no staff in the terrace bar/cafe when we arrived, gasping for something to eat & drink. Lots of people checking in so receptionist was too busy to help. No tea/coffee making facilities in room either, so eventually decided to go into city for something. Breakfast a bit sparse for the price too. So not good marks for the food, but everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly and stylish”
Reviews.Author: fr333zin
Reviews.Content: There's a touch of zen about this friendly small hotel in one of Barcelona's beachier suburbs. Our room was on the top - 4th floor, plenty of space with slate and glass used to good effect, and novel lighting. Each pair of adjoining rooms are themed with a different seaside scene in blue monochrome which lights up behind the bed. It's cooler than it sounds and the room was pleasantly designed without being too 'designer'. Room had good aircon, minibar and a free safe. The Maritimo is comfortable and very quiet as there is scarcely any passing traffic and no bars or clubs nearby; but you can easily travel into the centre for liveliness if you need to - only 6/7 stops away. Situated about 5 minutes walk from Selva de Mar Metro, right next to the Diagonal Mar park, and about 5 mins walk from the nearest stop on the Bus Turistic green route. Breakfast was poor on value for me at 12 euros however the food was good quality and the serving staff all try to please. There's little in the way of alternatives nearby, though, but better choice in the evenings. Main thing I missed was there's no drink making facilities in the room, you could order room service but we didn't test it. We'd definitely go back if visiting Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “such a lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: natalie a
Reviews.Content: great location! just out of the city's hussle and bussle, but only 2 stops on the metro from the great shopping or clubbing area! this was the nicest hotel of our europe holiday! very clean, very modern rooms. great location, there were lots of restaurant/cafe's/bars on the same block. cheaper to eat out then at the hotel. nearest metro station was about a 4min walk and transport is cheap. only down side was that the staff didnt speak very good enough, but still managed okay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - limited amenities”
Reviews.Author: Hevfred
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for five nights in October while husband was on business for a couple of those days. We liked the decor andlocation of the hotel - 8 metro stops away from the heart of Old Barcelona. 10 minutes walk to the beach and only a few minutes away from the nearest shopping mall which had lots of clothes shops and restaurants. 30 Euros taxi ride from the airport. On the downside, hotel had no pool, no tea/coffee in the room and satellite TV only had BBC World News and CNN channels in English. No ironing board in room - 6 Euro charge to iron one shirt. Very pricey on drinks, although there is a mini bar in the room so you can buy your own and store in there. Breakfast was a limited buffet selection at 12.50 Euros and hotel seemed a little understaffed as service for tea/coffee at breakfast was poor, and drinks at night sat in the garden was practically non-existent. Air conditioning in the bedrooms was poor. Oh and beds were rock hard!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: angester
Reviews.Content: Maybe its a Spanish thing as tonight I am in another "4 Star" and it is most definitely what I would expect from this rating. The Vincci was perfectly fine. I was there for a business trip and the location was really quite good with very close proximity to the beach and ample very interesting restaurants as well as fab shopping close by. I have travelled to Barcelona on many occasions so was not too stressed about not being in the city - in fact it was a welcome relief. Nearby you have the "little Ramblas" - I am sure they have a better name than that but basically lots of good choices for eating and Port Olympic is no distance away. Staff were friendly, outdoor eating area was really nice. Wireless is extortionate but that seems to be the norm so I wouldn't blame the hotel for that one - tonights hotel has same although free wireless in the lobby! Rooms are clean but yes beds are quite hard. I would definitely recommend for an outside of the city or even shopping trip.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back!”
Reviews.Author: gaylemiddlemiss
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean, modern hotel, beautiful rooms and bathroom. Thought the windows were one way view, it gave that impression? Thought we could see out and nobody could see in but we found out that to be WRONG! Be Warned!!! Situated opposite end to Port Vell. Short walk to the beach, wish I had took swimwear as the pool looked inviting but didn't think it would be warm enough in October, I was wrong! Decent walk to Port Olympic but a nice one along the coastline. Local metro on the doorstep and easy to use to get to the Ramblers or Port Vell... could walk but it is aprox a couple of miles. Ate nearby where all the shops are, Diagnol Mar, much cheaper than the Ports and the Ramblas. Hotels prices are fair and menu looks good. Only stayed two nights for short break which was ideal for my partner and I.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: withchildren85
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our two children. They have adequate rooms for four, whickh is not very usual.. The beach is at 10 min walking distance, and the tube at 2 min. Nice place to go. We missed a swimming pool, and maybe other serrvices expected in a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Alexlui
Reviews.Content: I go quite often to this hotel, both for business and leisure. Last Visit in July for a weekend with my wife. What I like ore is the location, with easy free parking and metro station at 300 mt. The furnishing is modern and simple but with all the comforts. During summer time the beach, not farer than 500 mt., is very wide and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a business trip, I wouldn't spend a holiday there though for bu”
Reviews.Author: madridvoyageur
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks new, the rooms are quite nice and quiet. Breakfast is good. It is very conveniently located for the 22@ business area (3 stops of tramway going up Diagonal). Add 15€/day for wifi Internet access. On the other hand, I wouldn't choose this hotel for a holiday in Barcelona ; no swimming pool (the over-crowded Mar Bella beach is at 10 minutes walking distance though), really far away from the center (there is a metro nearby) and located in a very residential area.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and would definatly go back”
Reviews.Author: Lorz11
Reviews.Content: the hotel was gorgeous, the rooms were spotless and the beds and towels were always crisp and fresh, the staff at reception were so polite and would help in anyway possible even if it was just to give directions, we kept a copy of the hotel address in our pocts at all times as some taxi drivers did not know where the hotel was but with having the address we were brought straight to the door, its a 5 min walk to the beach and 5 mins in taxi into bara square

Reviews.Title: “Clean Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonefishwidow
Reviews.Content: Vincci Maritimo was a haven after a hectic day of sightseeing in Barcelona. The beach was only a 5 minute walk away as is the Metro. There is a huge shopping mall at the end of the block, a great place for quick meals. But, there are sidewalk cafes, bakeries and fruit stands everywhere. The area around the hotel is quiet and very safe. It is a 30+ euro trip to and from the airport. I would not recommend taking the Metro with luggage as there are just too many transfer points, and it is not like Madrid or London where it is a quick walk to the next line - it can seem like miles! The Metro in Barcelona was not my favorite form of transportation, but certainly the least expensive. The only drawback with the Vincci hotel is their terrible beds - the hardest I have ever slept on in my life! They did add extra blankets to try and ease the bruising, but they were still pretty hard. Overall a very nice hotel, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: aracne63
Reviews.Content: Don't let the location discourage you from staying here, getting around Barcelona is so easy that staying a little farther away from La Rambla or other centric locations can save you a lot of money. This hotel is nice, close to public transportation and also has a good restaurant you can go to for late dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but some foibles”
Reviews.Author: PeterVee7
Reviews.Content: We knew from the start that this hotel was not located in the centre of town, so that was not an issue. The surrounding area of the hotel is nice; upscale residental with a 10 min walk to the beach. Anohter plus is the closeness to the big Diagonal Mar mall that has a huge supermarket, lots of restaurants and shops as well as a cinema (movies in Spanish only though). The subway is a 5 minute walk from the hotel, and then another 10 mins on the subway takes you to the city centre. The breakfast was relatively cheap at €10/person and good, although nothing spectacular. Our main annoyance with this hotels was the lack of a flat-iron. There just isn't one to be had at all. Instead the hotel offers an ironing service that charges €5 to iron a blouse that is ready for you the next day. To us, that just isn't acceptable in a four star hotel. So if you saw two tourists with wrinkly clothes last week in Barcelona, that could have been us :-). Another gripe was that there was no free Wi-Fi, and the charge for 45 min of Internet access was €7.5, which seems a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel close to the beach and congress centre”
Reviews.Author: kenshiho
Reviews.Content: I stsyed 6 nights due to an international congress. The congress center is at walking distance. This was the main reason I chose this hotel. The hotel is very modern and clean. The rooms are nice and comfy. Good air conditioning. No street noice. I slept like a baby. The beach is just one block away, which is great for those early morning runs. The subway is a block away. Very easy to get downtown to the main sights. The housekeeping was thorough. The Staff were all very helpful and nice. All spoke English fluently. The breakfast buffet was heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: caseyjs
Reviews.Content: Simply put if i ever went back to barcelona i would return to this hotel!! The staff were lovely and especially helpful to us first time tourists, the rooms and bathrooms were great, everything was clean and the location was great. 5 minute walk to the nearest beach, and the metro station was just around the corner which was cheap and got you into the centre of town in 10 minutes. Beautiful area and a great place to stay. Only word of warning, just outside the front of the hotel can sometimes reek due to the sewage, but it is totally unnoticeable inside the hotel itself and this shouldnt put you off.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in decent location”
Reviews.Author: shaidet
Reviews.Content: A bit off the beaten path, but VERY convenient to the metro and a wonderful pakistani grocery store to stock the room up with snacks! Rooms were clean, but bathroom walls, which are all frosted glass, could've been cleaner. - fingerprints and splash marks. Beds were comfortable and we all slept very well! The food in the hotel was ho-hum, and the restaurant service was just average, but the front desk people were very attentive and wonderful! We had a private tour guide meet us at the hotel one day and take us to Sagrada Familia plus other top sights. *Note: private tour guides are WELL worth the money - if you go, book one! The hotel is situated within a 5 min walk to a mall where we had fun shopping and then eating at an excellent mediterranean restaurant located just off the food court. Overall, this was a nice hotel - and a good value! Why doesn't trip advisor have a rating of "good" to fall between "Average" and " Very Good"? If they did, that's what this hotel would be!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, very good location - one block from subway & one block from beach”
Reviews.Author: Travelerspain75
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two weeks vacation in Spain. I was happy with our stay of three nights at this hotel. Staff is friendly and they know english so you can communicate easy. There is a supermercado (the spanish version of canadian malls) one block away where you can have dinner and breakfast or buy food from the basement huge food store. The subway station is one block away and a 15 - 20 minutes ride to DT Barcelona (1.45 euro a trip). The beach is one block away too, so you can combine site sightening with some beach time. The Hop On, Hop Off bus station is one block away so you do not need to take the subway to City center and all the atractions. There is an entertainment (Disney like) theme park close buy - we haven't visited it - so no comments (but good for those with kids). Lots of restaurants around. The neighbouhood looks very safe and upscale - we came back from restaurants at 2.00 in the morning and walk around to the beach at 12.00 at night - no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but not practical or comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Juan187147
Reviews.Content: The architect designed a minimalist hotel with lots of glass panels and white cubes, BUT you can't see to shave or make-up in the bathrooms with their tinted mirrors and poor lighting and you may struggle to operate the complicated device to operate the washbasin plug: it's easier to wash with running water. The bidets have no plugs at all, so it's a case of running water again. If you are overweight or over 40 don't risk the bath or shower. No where to hold on for safety at all. One of our party slipped and fell and another couldn't get out of the bath safely without help. The bath is just a domestic model with no ridges or mat to prevent slipping and only a wet glass panel to hang on to if you need support. The hanging rail of the small wardrobe is about 2 metres up so help may be needed to hang up or reach for your clothes unless you are above normal height. Oh, and there's only room stand 1 single suitcase unless you use the floor or one of the beds. Breakfast was tolerable but not as good as similar starred hotels and in the buffer there were no tables to sit and eat: only more white cubes with nowhere to put your knees. As one of the charming staff admitted with a smile: "Un hotel lindo pero no practico". Maybe the architect was sipping an elegant cocktail when a student instead of trudging to the lecture on ergonomics, health and safety.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Lucygooner
Reviews.Content: Do not choose this hotel if you want to be close to the city centre! It is a fews stops on the Metro which however, is very close to the hotel. The hotel itself is modern, clean light an airy. The rooms were a very good size with lovely facilities - one slight issue I booked a Queen bed but they only had twins available....they were "together" but would be an issue if you really wanted a double. Also, the air con was a little badly behaved! The staff were polite and friendly - the bar not alwasy staffed but someone soon came once called! There is a large shopping "mall" a two minute walk away which has a lot of good shops, a very big supermarket (cheap wine etc) and some good eateries on the top floor - some which have terrace style option. All in all I would say go and stay here, but probably not ideal for smaller children

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Keefieboy
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the other reviews of this place, I could form the opinion that there are actually two Vincci Maritimo's existing in parallel universes - one good, one bad. We just got back from a 2-night stay, and we were very happy with it. I loved the design, especially the bathrooms (being able to see the plumbing doesn't bother me at all), the staff were very friendly and helpful, the beds were good (I like a firm bed), and the location was sensible - away from the noise of the city centre; but within walking distance of 2 Metro stations, a tram line and buses, the beach and a shopping mall. We only ate there for breakfast, and I would have to say it wasn't great - you couldn't assemble anything much like a proper Spanish breakfast, let alone an English one from the goods on offer, and the safe in the room (which can be operated by any of your cards that has a magnetic strip) needed anything between 10 and 20 swipes to make it open. And they could redesign the garden/terrace - put in a pool and some exotic plants. But those are minor niggles - we liked it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Very smart”
Reviews.Author: BNAUK
Reviews.Content: We were quite lucky with this hotel, when we booked we found a deal on the internet for a three day stay of around 120 euros a night, when we arrived the reception prices were about 350 euros a night. No wonder our little Ford hire car looked out of place in the underground car park next to the lamborghini. Clean and tidy hotel. A little far from central Barcelona but the underground is about 300m up the road to obtian a day travel pass. The hotel breakfast was a joke though. My wife ordered scrambled eggs which wheather you like undercooked eggs is fine by me, but I like mine to spend a little time in the pan cooking. And dont look at your bill on the room tv. When we saw ours it was all wrong which did worry us a little. Our stay in Barcelona was great though. Well worth a visit. Watch out for pick pockets.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: FlyingSquirell
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during our visit in Barselona and that I can say it definetly not deserve four stars.....the best thing is quite good location, because it's not the city centrum and metro and shopping mall is near. But rooms are not so nice like in the photos...and the contitioners was not working properly....So it's more or less ok hotel....but if you have time choose another one.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good!”
Reviews.Author: Janakii
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vincci Maritimo as I needed to be near this end of Diagonal Mar. Checking in was fine- there was a trainee as well as the main receptionist and they were both very polite and efficient (and with perfect English). Room was large though view was a little dull (concrete park). Bed was comfortable- nice firm mattress, and the bathroom was v nicely designed. As others have mentioned the metro is just a v short walk away (turn left out of the hotel and then the first right); and if you were to turn right and right out of the hotel, you head straight to the beach, heading past the rather large shopping centre with decent restaurants. The main restaurant within the hotel was pretty good- the food tasty and service friendly and nice. Downside was definitely the lack of free Internet. All in all, I would recommend this hotel should you want to be away from the city centre, but with the convenience of the metro to get to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lizzle812
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I have a personal preference for staying outside of the city center wherever I go, so this hotel was a perfect fit. It was a three minute walk to the Metro, which was very well designed and got us into Catalunya Square quickly and easily. It also was located right down the street from a mall, which because it was a holiday whilst we were there, was one of the few places to eat. The hotel staff was courteous, friendly and knowledgeable-- they were always willing to answer any of our questions and had an excellent grasp of English (which is something you definitely don't find everywhere in Spain). The bed in the room was new, the amenities were great, and the water pressure in the shower was perfect. My one complaint is that the bathroom had glass walls, so if you had someone else in the room with you, they could hear EVERYTHING. I would definitely recommend-- the 10 minute walk to beaches is especially great.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible; expensive; and badly located”
Reviews.Author: StephHampshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in early October 2010 on business, but never, even again. Quite possibly the worst hotel I have EVER stayed in. It's quite modern, and the staff are helpful, but that's the only good parts. Let's start with the restaurant: terrible food (although cheap, which may explain the quality) and three items missing from the six on the menu. There's a 24 Euro charge for 24 hours internet - I paid less at the Four Seasons in the Maldives last April! You hear all the noise in the corridor (thank you to the guy who slammed his doot at 2am and woke me up). Plus the rooms are badly designed: glass covers the wash basin, so you can see all the ugly plumming underneath...bizarre...and the Internet cable is too short. There are no other facilities within 200 yards of the hotel so you step into a bit of a wasteland. But probably the worst part is the price: 406 Euros for 2 nights, including a very cheap meal, couple of beers each night from the minibar and aforementioed Internet. This hotel is well overpriced for what it delivers. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, decent location, has parking garage”
Reviews.Author: jetter19
Reviews.Content: The Vincci Maritimo is a little outside of the main city of Barcelona, but is close to a Metro station and convenient to shopping and the beach. Hotel staff were courteous and helpful. Rooms were fine, beds firm but not rock hard, unlike other hotels in Spain. Only disappointment was no free wireless internet (charge was 24 euros / night). For travellers like us who had a rental car, the garage was a must (9 euros / night). I wrote an ealier review criticizing the Vincci for not refunding our previous reservation in April this year that had to be canceled because of the volcano eruption. Happy to report that Vincci was gracious enough to provide a credit for our stay in September, so I retract my earlier comments.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, modern, clean, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Harris81
Reviews.Content: We both really liked this hotel. I'm always nervous when hotels get some terrible ratings, but I'm glad we booked here anyway. As others have said, it is not central, but it is 2 mins from the metro which is cheap and quick. The upside is you are near the beaches. We walked as far as the Olympic village, along the coast. I think it took us an hour, but it was hot so we weren't going very fast! I'm not sure we would have seen these areas had we been in a more central hotel so I felt being further out was a bonus (and cheaper). If you walk towards the Hilton hotel there is a huge shopping centre with lots of (chain) eateries and a supermarket. There is a lovely park near the hotel with children's play area, duck pond etc. If you turn left when you come out the hotel, we found a whole avenue of lovely street restaurants about 20 mins walk away. There is also a supermarket a couple of blocks in this direction from the hotel. The room was great. We were pleased to have a fridge in the room. When we arrived they offered us breakfast for the week at a rate of 6 Euros a day if we paid for the whole week. Can't comment on breakfast, we took advantage of the fridge and just stocked up on crossaints, yoghurt & fruit. The bed was lovely, a queen size and comfortable. The bathroom was gorgeous, modern frosted glass, great shower, bidot and bath. The rooms were kept really clean. We ate in the restaurant once and had their set evening menu. It was good value, but some courses were better than others. The pork and cheese starter were good. The veal burger and mushroom pasta less so. The waitress was fantastic though, she appeared to speak at least 4 languages and she made us feel really welcome. I understand why some people have commented on the reception staff, they weren't the warmest I'd met, but I didn't find them rude at all. We had some problems with our key cards, but it only takes a minute to reactivate them. My only criticism was that there wasn't a pool. I really wish we had had one, especially as the neighbouring block of flats has one that our room overlooked and it was so hot it'd been nice to have that option. There are 2 other Vincci hotels in Barcelona and one has a pool so would be worth looking at that one too.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: susiegotyournumber
Reviews.Content: Absolutely unhappy with this hotel. First of all, staff at the reception was rude and unfriendly. The room key demagnetized five times in four days and no one at the reception even bothered saying "sorry". They just told me that I should not keep the key close to my credit card or mobile phone, which I never did. The room was not so bad, clean enough, but the problem was the bathroom. The shower had very low pressure, wich was annoying, and the bathtub tap was not well fixed to the wall. It was moving! I've never seen anything like that. And this should be a four star hotel... The bed was hard and not particularly confortable and the walls were so thin that I heard everything in the corridor and in the room nearby. And, as if this was not enough, internet access was expensive and breakfast overprced. Last but not least, the area was appalling, far away from the city center, but at least the tube was one block away and a big mall with many shops and eateries in a walking distance. Even if I ever come back to Barcelona, I'll never stay again at the Vincci Maritimo.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachcomberFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: After a weeks stay at the Vincci in May, I had another stay in June. It was a pleassant stay at a well meintained place. The room size is sufficient, the bed comfortable, with extra blankets, when the nights are cooler. Central AC facitlity, Minibar, TV with Internet. The bathroom is nicely integrated / separated by glass walls. Staff is freindly and efficient. Check-in is typically fast, Check-out can be tough, when a lot of people are queuing up in the morning. Breakfast offers a huge variety of the usual stuff + chilled cava, which I didn't want to taste at the start of a working day. Greatest advantage for me was the location within walking distance to the place I visited.

Reviews.Title: “Barca's Boutique Babe's Brill.”
Reviews.Author: spotbot1
Reviews.Content: I'm really glad I dismissed the negative reviews for this Chic Hotel, yes it's in a Commercial area with lots of building works nearby & yes it's a 35 Euro cab from the Airport & yes theres not a mass of eateries close by but the up side is; it cost us 75 euros per room per night with breakfast at 12 Euros, plenty of choice from Bacon & Eggs,Pastries, Cold meats,Cheeses, Fresh fruit, Yoghurts, Fresh juices,Tea,Coffee, Toast,Jams,Honey & even Bucks Fizz. The Evening Menu was a little expensive but there was plenty of choice in the Gigantic Shopping Mall around the corner,also ideal for the Ladies I think, the Beach is 2 minutes walk away, as is the Metro/Tram lines (10 trip ticket 7.85 Euros) which takes you all over the City, so not so far out really. There's also a couple of small Parks adjacent to the Hotel & on the way to the Metro an authentic Spanish Bar that does a proper Coffee in a glass & food thats as cheap as chips, as Dave would say. Buy the Discount booklet at the Hotel for 4 Euros each, it will get you 6 Euros each off the Barca Tour Bus (Well worth doing,3 different routes & you can use same ticket on all 3) plus lots of other discounts. The rooms in the Hotel are large & very contemporary with hugh beds & glass panelled bathrooms,the knack with the Air Con is to leave a card in & leave it on & don't open the window as this turns it off. Remember this is an up & coming area so may not be all you desire but its clean,reasonably priced (If you search) & with in minutes of La Rambla by Metro. The best bit I found was the staff (Specially Robinson & Anais), they allowed our friends to book in early on their arrival & on our return from our Cruise all of us to book in early, also on our departure day they allowed us to keep the room till 2pm & not Noon, all this was at no extra charge, also they arranged taxi's to where ever we wanted & even recommended a Restaurant at the Olympic Port & showed us places to visit on the map & more, I couldn't fault any of them, so Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “won't go back - no air conditioning at night (from 9pm till noon)”
Reviews.Author: sky-p
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quite far away from the airport (1hr 15mins if using tram & metro and 30-40mins by taxi). When we arrived the hotel it was at the back of nine at night. There was only one staff behind reception and there was a queue for checking in. Room was clean enough but there was no air conditioning at night which is a pain as it was really warm when we visited Barcelona. You will need to pay for internet and there's no free wi-fi. (cant remember how much it was for the tarriff) I will not recemmend this hotel and certainly will not stay here again if we are going back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “good but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: cporoski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week and were very satisfied. IT was far away from the main attractions but it was a block from the subway station so that was no problem for us. It was quiet at night and the bathrooms were new. We did have a problem that a message was left for us at the front desk that we never heard about because we didn't specifically ask about it. But otherwise they were great. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a modern hotel at a resonable price.

Reviews.Title: “don't recognise others' reviews. had a great time here”
Reviews.Author: boredofthis
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at VM. Staff were friendly and helpful, and will speak English, though my husband made the effort to speak in Spanish. The room was clean and very comfortable, and we slept well as the area is quiet at night. The impressive bathroom has a rain shower. Heaven! A short walk away is the Poble Nou area with excellent cafes and restaurants, and a short bus ride takes you into the centre of Barcelona.The underground station is close too. I have no complaints, and will return to the VM when I am next in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Don't make non-refundable reservations with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jetter19
Reviews.Content: We had reservations to the Vincci Maritimo but had to cancel because of the flight cancellations caused by the Icelandic volcano with the unpronouncable name. So we never made it to Barcelona. The hotel manager was unsympathetic, natural disaster or not, no refund or a credit for future stay would be allowed. The other hotels we booked with refunded us as long as we gave 24 hours notice. I've had to make non-refundable reservations before out of necessity; this is the first time I got burnt. Could have been avoided by booking a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you hate sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle1898
Reviews.Content: Pleate note - I have never ever taken the time to review anything online. THAT'S how strongly I feel about warning you about this hotel. We got a great package deal through one of the major booking websites - there were many hotel choices and since we are not picky travelers AT ALL...we went for one of the less expensive options. Doing it again I would have GLADLY spent more for a different hotel. I'll cover for what us, are the most important factors in deciding where to stay. Again, please realize, we are NOT "snooty" travelers. We often backpack, stay in hostels, on couches etc... You will never hear me complain about smudges on mirrors, towels that aren't soft enough etc. Even room size - I don't care about that because we are never there except to sleep. Which brings me to why I feel so strongly about this place. THE BED. We didn't sleep. We stayed six nights and never got more than 3 hours of sleep at a time. The bed was SO HARD. Even more terrible than a hard bed - you can feel each and every giant metal spring in the mattress and when you or your partner move around THE SPRINGS MAKE NOISE. Like, noises similar to the beating of a little drum. I'm not exaggerating. At one point I went to sleep in the bathtub but had to get out because the shower leaked. We are young, in shape and ALWAYS sleep SOUNDLY on vacation. We woke up aching, in pain and exhausted. The bed and quality of sleep single-handedly just about ruined our vacation. IF FOR NO OTHER REASON THAN THIS - PICK A DIFFERENT PLACE TO STAY. YOU WILL NOT SLEEP, I PROMISE PROMISE PROMISE YOU! Other than that... this place had other negative things going for it. The desk staff was pretty rude. Whatever, not a big deal - we never talk to them. There are no late night (or any other time of day for that matter) eateries in the area. There isn't much at all in the area - it's pretty empty, the economy has hit this area pretty hard - most things are closed down and covered in graffiti. The food at the hotel is so expensive, there is no way we would even consider eating it. It's on the outskirts of the city center - there is nothing fun/exciting/"Barcelona" in the area. The only positives; Close to the subway - about a five minute walk. A mall down the street which contains a giant grocery store Mini fridge in the room in which to store our grocery store food. The beach is only about 3 blocks away which made for a nice walk along the water into the city center. When we checked in I saw the "normal" rates they charge to stay there. You have got to be out of your freakin mind to pay full price at this place. I couldn't believe my eyes. If we hadn't received a great package deal I would have never booked this place. Even still - I would have GLADLY paid more for a better place to stay. Considering the only positive things this place has going for it - you will see right away that those things can be found AT A PLETHORA OF OTHER HOTELS. The negatives highly outweigh the positive things this hotel has going for it. I would HIGHLY SUGGEST choosing a hotel nearer to the city - PLEASE pick another hotel. You will regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Metro Station, safe and clean”
Reviews.Author: mrh0922
Reviews.Content: I liked staying at this hotel because it was close to the metro station and in a quieter part of the city. Rooms were clean with a rain shower. I had no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “unprofessional & unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JuRyMalta
Reviews.Content: this hotel is difficult to get to from barcelona centre. I also asked for a spoon from the restaurant to take up to my room but the receptionist fervently would not allow it for some odd reason. Receptionists do not speak english and it was very difficult to communicate with them. Expensive for the services offered. We were given one towel (in a double room) and internet connection is exorbetantly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location close to Metro, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: Spontaneous_Gypsy
Reviews.Content: We got a chance to stay at the hotel last week. The room was comfortable. There was no internet access due to issues due to construction nearby. Best thing about the hotel was the close proximity to the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and good rooms! Book early for special rates!!”
Reviews.Author: Luschnoar
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mainly because of the great pre-paid rate it offered! We paid less than 80 euros not including the breakfast! The breakfast costs 12.85 and is worth the money - lots of fruits, cold cuts, etc. The hotel is located a little outside of the city, a few minutes by foot to the underground station "Selva del mar", the tram stop, and the diagonal shopping centre! Also the clean and nice beach with a fun beachbar, is within 10 minutes by foot! It is a residential areas, safe and quiet by night, a few small cafes and shops are located in the streets around the hotel! It takes around 15 minutes to get to the city center, after metro closing hours a taxi will take you for less than 10 euros!! The rooms are good size, clean and elegant... The bathroom shows some signs of use (mold in the corners, some scratches, etc) but is still in good shape! We were surprised about the little details (safe can be opened with your credit card, lots of accessories provided such as bath sponge, tooth brush, etc etc, dirty laundry compartment, ...). The only downturn is that there is no fitness room provided and that the internet in the room costs 9.- per hour! The staff was nice and helpful at all times... Maps, information material, free newspaper are provided in the lobby. We had a great time here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern and Contemporary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jules73Manchester
Reviews.Content: On Arrival the receptionist was very helpful.The room was exceptionally hot when entering but once the air conditioning was altered it soon cooled and became comfortable. The room was very clean modern and contemporary with a huge bed unfortunately the pillows were a little too soft for us, so took us a few nights to adjust. The bathroom was impressive with lots of sample items for your use. Our room overlooked the park, which at times was noisy but what do you expect local families to do of a weekend when a park is there for their use. We were disappointed their was no tea/coffee making facilities available in the room and not alot of local cafes selling breakfast as the hotel was expensive. The japanese garden was a delight, very tranquil. The journey to Las Ramblas/Nou Camp/Airport was made easy using the Metro system and purchasing a T-10 ticket at 7 euros 70 was great value for a couple. The local beach is a must,very clean and sandy and lots going on, we enjoyed our day relaxing there after sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sinisa1971
Reviews.Content: Since I stayed in this hotel with a group of 70 people, reading some of the reviews here I really doubt those people know what they are talking about! Hotel is genuine 4star hotel in a very fancy quarter (fast growing Diagonal del Mar area). I read here that hotel is in unsafe area? People - get informed. The parc close to the hotel is notable for landscape architects - very unique place. Rooms are clean (I used 35 rooms for my group, and NONE had been dirty). Hotel is modern, not really warm but clean, nicely decorated - it deserves 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain”
Reviews.Author: rs1126
Reviews.Content: We stayed (my wife and I) for a week at this hotel that is located not far from the Malaga Beach on the Mediterranean but somewhat distant from the city center. I want to add that the hotel was good, especially for the price (less than $100 a night but the euro was depressed then). The hotel staff were somewhat surly and one in particular was very picky about eating at the hotel restaurant only. I thought that was somewhat out of line since we enjoy picking up some fruits, vegetables and bread and some local wine and enjoying that. Fortunately there were some nice local grocery stores as well as a fairly large supermarket (El Campo) that was truly marvellous. The room was very modern, ours faced the sea side, but I imagine rooms facing the street side were a little less pleasant to look at. There are several Metro stations within walking distance and they operate very efficiently. Of course a visit to Sangria cathedral made famous by the sculptor Antonio Gaudi and a walk around Las Ramblas is a must. Much better to eat there than in the hotel. Overall we were satisfied with the hotel but the hotel staff could learn to be less grumpy and smile more to assure customer service is always on top of their agenda.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Nikko001
Reviews.Content: Barcelona - next to Paris one of the most romantic places I have ever visited - great hotel - nice very modern rooms - good locations - very accessible - 1min from main metro entrance

Reviews.Title: “Sad”
Reviews.Author: CarlAdam
Reviews.Content: Not what we expected when we booked this hotel. Looks nice on the pictures, although the location is not very central and the atmosphere wasnt really the what we were looking for, equals, relaxed, nice and chique where you feel at home.Tried to switch room several times as the room we got was very dirty and unpleasant (the windows were so dirty we could almost see through them) . No response at all which is a big minus.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chlobo9
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were unimpressed with the neighborhood and did not feel very safe but decided to give it a chance. After checking in with the lackluster staff, we went up to our tiny, dirty rooms. The rooms looked as though they had not been cleaned, with oily smears on the bathroom glass wall and curly mystery hairs on the pillows. We called the front desk and they told us that our room had been cleaned and that they did not have any other double rooms. The customer service was poor, and they did not seem concerned with the dirty state of the room or our dissatisfaction. After a half hour, we had booked another hotel online and checked out of this hotel. They would not give us the managers name or contact information and the hotel staff made it very difficult to get our money back. They charged us for one night, which we did not mind as long as we did not have to stay in those disgusting rooms. We will never stay at another Vincci hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Mark L
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights and the hotel was very modern and clean! The reception staff were very helpful and all had good english! the location was excellent as mar bella beach, the metro and shopping centre all within 2 minutes walk from hotel! the only problem with the hotel is the restaurant and lack of hotel bar!! breakfast and dinner are a complete rip-off and not even dat good for the price ur paying! surely any 4 star hotel has to have a bar and leisure centre, well not here so 4 star hotel dont think so!

Reviews.Title: “Not so good as i hoped”
Reviews.Author: IrVD
Reviews.Content: We were staying in this hotel in the end of August. Impressions of hotel are not the best. There were badly working bath and WC. The reservation was made on expanded double room, but really it seemed like standard one. By the check-out time I had found out that the TV costs 25 euros even if I wasn’t watching any extra TV channel. We didn't use the TV at all. I was using only internet. It costs 9 euro per day. I did not manage to find the pool. The way to the city centre by public transport takes about 30 minutes. If your aim is to see sightseeing of the city you should take some of the hotels in the center of BCN.

Reviews.Title: “Vincci Maritimo style”
Reviews.Author: Joala
Reviews.Content: Have used this hotel several times on business trips. Very clean, stylish and modern. A bit lacking in atmosphere. Good location for Diagonal Mar shopping mall but too far out of the centre for me to consider it if on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Dellydonut
Reviews.Content: Chose the Vincci due to its proximity to the Summercase Festival at the Forum, its not exactly convenient for the city despite great metro system. Rooms large, clean and modern. Unfortunately the beds felt like old spring matresses and were really noisy and uncomfortable. Walls also seemed really thin, was repeatedly awoken by others letting their doors slam or talking loudly along the corridors. Convenient for our needs but cant recommend it for a stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: Ajco1970
Reviews.Content: The Good Bits This is not a bad hotel at all and so I don't want to appear negative but it just doesn't cut it as a 4 star either in my opinion. Although the location is definitely not city centre, there is a metro station and a tram stop less than 200 metres away. Travelling time to the city centre is about 10-15 minutes and so this is not a problem. The beach is about 500 metres away which is also a big plus. The rooms are clean, the fit out is modern and the receptionists are quite friendly and so first impressions were quite good on the whole. The Rest But the little things matter and this is where the hotel falls down. Arriving for a conference the following morning, the hotel does not provide an iron. There is a laundry service apparently but only at certain times of the day and the receptionist was not clear at all on the details and was very sceptical that anything could be laundered within 24 hours if at all. Everything shuts after 11pm, including room service. Even the front door is locked around midnight and you might have to knock to gain entry if the receptionist isn't paying attention. There was no kettle in the room, so even a simple cup of tea is impossible after 11pm and given that this is primarily a residential area there are no real options available in the vicinity either. There is no gym or pool and the terrace is definitely a pleasure reserved solely for the underprivileged. Conclusion I have an impression that this is primarily a tourist hotel aimed at the low to mid-budget market - long weekending accountants from the UK and that sort of thing and the attire and palour of the guests reflected it. In fact, in some ways the hotel is like a Premier Inn or Travelodge which isn't a bad thing at all but it is hardly worthy of 4 stars. I wouldn't stay here again although I didn't totally dislike the experience - I just think there are better alternatives available.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a 4 star hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jill1London
Reviews.Content: I was on my honeymoon and i simply love this hotel.. It is so near to the beach and the metro train to the town. I would definitely recommend to my friends!!! A+++

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: tanakken
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed here for a week of vacation and had a great stay. It's a very convenient location with subway access to the rest of the city close by. A nice new building, clean and accessible. The only issue we had was with a concierge service that was at times friendly and helpful, and at other times rushed, short, and busy. But, I definitely recommend this for vacationers willing to be just outside the city center. We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nessie1978
Reviews.Content: Hotel Maritimo Vincci was still very new, as was the neighbourhood where building contractors were developing more hotels. We got a good deal on the bookings.com website. The room was extremely speacious, great interior decorating, fabulous rainshower AND a big bath tub. We one had dinner at the hotel on the really beautiful terrace. It was a bit expensive, but the food was excellent and so was the service. A few negative points: it took us 3 times going up and down to the reception (which was a bit frustrating since we just had spend hours in the heat in our car travelling from Marseille to Barcelona) before we finally received a key that worked. The airco was too strong for me. Great when searchin for some coo air after walking in the blistering sun, but at night it really got chilling. This is entirely personal, I do not support airco easily (I always get a nasty cold afterwards), nor the sound when it turns on every five minutes while sleeping. At the time (August 2005) the area did not have many restaurants or bakeries, but we did have the Barceloneta beach very near. I remember mainly that we did a real bargain in getting such a luxurious room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel shame about the ironing!”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: I had a conference at the convention center and got a great rate (GBP70 per night) on this hotel through a travel site. First impressions were excellent. I arrived late (~10:00pm) on a Sunday evening and immediately thought that the hotel looked good. Room was very modern, superbly clean, etc. The problem came when I looked for an iron. There was none - no coffee making facilities either but there was a well stocked mini-bar. So I went down to reception and asked for an iron. They didn’t have one. Get this - the only way to iron a shirt in this 4* hotel is to put it in the laundry – for this they charge you 5 euro (or 7.50 euro for the express service if you need it turned around quickly). The receptionist couldn’t understand why I thought that not being able to iron a shirt in a 4* hotel was ‘poor’ when our conversation was cut short because a lady in her 50s ran in having just had her handbag snatched outside! I ran out with her (the concierge wandered out as well) only to see a guy getting into a car about 100 yds down the road. So she lost her passport, money, mobile phone, etc. Not a great introduction to the hotel. So, onto the facts. I’d happily recommend the hotel to those needing somewhere close to the convention center. It’s a modern hotel and everything works. My room was a good size and comfortable. The bath is full size which is a real luxury in hotels these days. The area is not ‘bad’. I guess bag snatching happens in all cities everywhere – especially late on Sunday evenings in deserted streets. I guess they target the tourist/conference areas. One person I was discussing the incident with last had her bag snatched in London. That said, the hotel is not as noise free as I’d like. I could hear the wake-up call next door every morning (about an hour before I wanted to wake up) and a baby screaming at 5:00am seemed like it was in the same room. The internet works (7 euro for 1 hr and 17 euro for 24 hrs) but seems slooow – I suppose it is broadband, Jim – but not as we know it. The hotel does not appear to have a gym or other such facilities. The hotel is convenient for the conference center (10 mins) walk and is a couple of minutes from a large shopping center (Diagonal Mar – which you can walk through to get to the conference center as it’s across the road) which has countless bars/food outlets, etc. I didn’t use any of the hotel’s facilities. Breakfast was listed at 15 euros in the hotel and there was a Starbucks 2 mins down the road in the shopping center! I put my shirts for ironing in at 9:00am the next day and did get the express service one back within the hour. So I suppose I have to conclude that the service was good! Luckily I didn’t need it until midday. But, be warned, if you have a 9:00am meeting its crinkly shirt time. So, in summary, if it wasn’t for the ironing I’d be a happy traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value, Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: CHJH2007
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at this hotel in early February for my birthday weekend, and were slightly worried about some of the negative reviews regarding location.....please, please, please ignore those comments! The hotel is two minutes walk from the tube station, and you're in La Ramblas in 12 minutes. We got two "three day" passes on the underground, costing 30euros in total, and it was brilliant. You can get all over the city with that ticket, and it runs until 2am Friday / Saturday, and 12midnight other days. True, if you want to party until 4am, then you'll have to pay 10euros in a cab, but again, that's nothing compared to what you'll have spent! Brilliant staff, great breakfast (plenty to choose from for everyone), and really helpful reception check in / out, cab to airport etc, everything brilliant. next time I'm in Barceona I'll stay. Forget about getting ripped of on those tatty hotels on La Ramblas....stay here and enjoy a really nice hotel at a great price (300 euros for three nights)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, would definitely stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: Angeljkk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and visually very attractive. The facilities were great and kept in good order. The service was great. The buffet breakfast was excellent, had a great range of food and planty of it. Would definitely re-visit and recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so nice of a location”
Reviews.Author: Tokyodude
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this place during a convention that was held at the nearby convention center. First off the good: the hotel is fairly new so it's relatively clean, close to a big shopping mall with resturants and a huge supermarket. The staff were all helpful and most speak English without a problem. The bathroom is nice with a shower that spouts like a gallon of water a second. The hotel is also fairly close to the convention center so if you have business there, it's a walking distance (10 minutes or so). Now the bad: Since the convention center is located in an area of Barcelona which is far from the center of the city, you won't get the full Barcelona experience if just stay around this area (it's fairly dead at night). You can of course take the subwar to the center of the city, but it's a hassel none the less. The hotel charges 9 Euros per hour for internet cost (think it was around 19 euros for 24 hours...still crazy prices). Overall, an OK stay, but next time, I would stay near the center of the city where there's more things to do at night.

Reviews.Title: “Minimal and Hip”
Reviews.Author: LeslieOC
Reviews.Content: For the price, this was a bargain. The hotel is very minimal and hip. It has amazing grounds/pool area, again very cutting edge and minimal. It has a bright airy cafe in the lobby.It is by itself, but a block from the hilton and many dining facilities. Next time I will stay at hotel 1898 on Las ramblas where all the action is, but it was a nice place to stay on my first day in barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Style together!”
Reviews.Author: sasherwani
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the Vincci for two days. It was a beautiful experience. The location is excellent. Close to the beach and the Diagnol Mar Mall. Only drawback is .. no Metro stop closeby and so we had to take a bus to move around Barcelona. Overall a great experience at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel but”
Reviews.Author: ariel666
Reviews.Content: when we were there the metro was under construction. check it before you go. the location is good and quiet and there is a parking space for free near by, so don't use the hotel parking. also it is close to the beach. the room is beutiful and comfortable. service is good and satisfy.

Reviews.Title: “Class Hotel Awesom City”
Reviews.Author: Bjorno
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in the Vincci Maritimo in August 07 for my Girlfriends 21st, and having read some of the reviews on here before going I must admit I was a little dubious...... But it was fantastic, lovely hotel (especially for the price we got from the BMI Baby Deal), very helpful staff who spoke excellent English. Only a 5 minute walk to the nearest beach, and then a lovely walk along the beachfront to Barcelonetta, Villa Olympic and then town. Neighbourhood nice enough, quite a lot of redevelopment going on, but the park next to the hotel is nice and we certainly didn't see any trouble. Metro only 2 min walk (although it was a replacement bus at the time) and after the metro stops at night the N6 nightbus stops right outside the hotel door and runs throughout the night, fantastic (just make sure you get on the bus in the right direction, we inadvertently went on a tour of the city!) Nice big modern rooms, good breakfast and whilst we preffered to go into town at night to eat the evening meal we had on our first night was very good. Great hotel for those wanting to explore and experience Barcelona, as long as you're not affraid to jump on metro's busses or use your feet., and some other reviewers need to realise that if you want everythng you have to pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the shower”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymaker020
Reviews.Content: I took my two teenage grand children for a short break to Barcelona and stayed at the Vincii Maritimo. The rooms were spacious and we enjoyed showering under the large shower head. The hotel was clean and staff were friendly and hepful. We ate breakfast at the hotel which was well presented with a good variety of savoury and sweet things. There was a 'summer special' breakfast price. We did have one evening meal at the hotel which was very pricey but excellent quality. The hotel is conveniently placed for public transport which was frequent, buses, trams and the metro. For shopping, Diagonal Mar is adequate. The block of flats opposite the hotel is a bit of an eyesore at first, but the surrounding area at the back of the hotel is pleasant. The beach is easily accessed from the hotel. We had an enjoyable walk along the beachfront.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: micnk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Vincci Maritimo for 3 nights, visiting Barcelona for a Congress. I booked the room from the internet. All describtions I had read about the hotel were totally verified. Nice and confortable rooms, excellent decoration, very friendly staff in reception, good communication in English. Internet facilities are provided with extra cost, while the room service operates around the clock. The location of the hotel is not perfect for someone wants to visit the city center frequently, but it was good for me as the Congress was taking place in a walking distance. The metro station is 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Grekgirlie
Reviews.Content: Reading previous reviews got me worried over this hotel but I really don't see any true in most of these bad reviews. This hotel was excellent, rooms are spacious, clean, modern and including all amenities. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great too and you could have it in the inside restaurant or garden area. I really don't see anything bad in the area as well (except an old building up front but it's not like it's in your room). I loved the area, beautiful buildings, hotels, offices, parks, huge roads, bus stop right in front of the hotel and metro just a few steps away. Mall just within 2 mins walk and the beach is very close too. I would defenately suggest this hotel to everyone and wouldn't take in mind these unfair bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: Aria00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the the hotel for 4 nights while attending a conference at the nearby CCIB. Like a recent review, I found the location of the hotel really surprising. It literally is like being in the ghetto. If you want the closest beach (which was closed due to construction work - well it was November!!!) that was a good 20 minute walk away. When it comes to the area late at night it was pretty seedy however didn't encounter any problems myself. Rooms: I was on the first floor and from seeing the pictures on this site was expecting to see a swish and cool decor. To be honest it was tired and unkept. I booked my hotel via the conference travel service and was sure it said free wifi however they where charging 9 euros an hour and the reception was poor. I ended up walking down to the local shopping centre and getting a network cable and using that instead as wired internet was free. The safe wasn't big enough for my laptop which I thought was odd for a business hotel as other ones I've stayed at like one recently in Brussels had safes designed for them. I ended up having to do something with a kensington lock, a suitcase and a wardrobe:) On arrival I thought I would get room service and ordered a ham and cheese baguette. The baguette was so tough it felt like it was going to cut my gums!!! Apart from that there was barely any filling so was not impressed.... I gave room service a miss after that. The hotel: I'm sure the owners of the hotel thought they had something really cool with their "starck like" style however its done to such a poor quality it just looks more naff than starck. The japanese garden was literally some grass, tables and chairs, some rasied planting areas that contained just bark??? Oh and some wooden posts.... The bar was big but empty. It looks like it should be a swanky cocktail bar but it didnt quite carry it off. I've been to better empty cocktail bars that have more character than this one. Breakfast was the usual European affair of something from everyone. Hopeing to get a nice English breakfast unfortunately the bacon was like chewing on slithers of leather, the eggs where soggy and well everything else was just poor. In my stay I unfortunately joined the enormous number of visitors to Barcelona who was pick pocketed (as did two other conference delegates I was out with that night). This was despite the fact my wallet was in the front pocket of my jeans.... As frustrating as it was for me those Catalans seem to have thieving down to an art!!!! When I got back to the hotel, the reception staff gave me a new key and opened my safe for me (the safe is controlled using your own credit/debit card) I couldn't get through to one of the numbers to cancel one of my cards due to a block on that number prefix not being allowed so they had to patch my call through. Not so much of a problem apart from the fact it took me a good five minutes to explain this to the staff as their English is about as good as my Catalan. Next day I spoke to the hotel about what do do about paying for my bill since the card I'd used to pay the deposit had now been blocked. For some reason they thought this would still be okay however looking back something was lost in translation there. Come check out day, you've guessed it "Can I have your card please?", "Sorry its been stolen. I spoke to your colleague?" , "You must have a card here to check out", "But I don't have one".... This went round and round for a few minutes and ended up waking my partner at five in the morning to ask her to give them their card details. For some reason thats no good though as they needed confirmation the card details could be used in writing by the card holder???? ARRRRGGGGHHHH. Eventually the lady at the desk agreed to accept an email of confirmation so half an hour later it was sorted out..... Summary: My biggest gripe about the hotel has to be how unhelpful the staff where when it came to having my wallet stolen and checking out. Lost in transalation is an under statement, the staff had no idea what I was saying and despite speakiing perfectly clear English, and this being a "business hotel" most of the time it seemed to take ages to get across what I was trying to say. Summing up in one line though, this hotel is unlikely to be the swish, cool place you expect it to be. If you are going to Barcelona on holiday I would suggest staying somewhere more central, there is nothing to see that far out . If you are going for business, you could do better than this. if you are going for a conference at the CCIB you will be much better off with the Barcelona Princess which is opposite the conference centre, or staying in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: GollMall
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of November 2006 for a short 3 night break. Good Points: - although the hotel is based in a residential district close to the beach the metro stop is 3 minutes walk away and it doesn't take long to get to La Rambla - aout 15 mins. Be aware the metro closes at midnight and after that you must get a taxi. - Rooms are big and very nice in design, very contemporary and good value at the price - Walls are too thin, you can hear everything from next door and the accross the corridor. We didn't have breakfast at the Hotel but at Mago which is opposite the shopping centre a few minutes away which was excellent value. A good hotel if you don't mind staying away from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Property Stolen From Suitcase”
Reviews.Author: Shaf_One
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit to Barcelona and the first time I stayed in this hotel, upon checking out at 12 I asked the reception to keep my baggage as my flight was not till later. I had brought a brand new shirt which was packed in my suitcase, when I arrived back in the UK I discovered my new shirt missing, no other items had been taken. Since then I have emailed the hotel on a number of occaisons and have received no response. I know that my shirt was in my suitcase and the only time it could have been taken is whilst the suitcase was in the custody of the hotel. What is even more disturbing is their lack of response or even ackowledgement. Apart from that the hotel and room were nice however the walls are so thin, if somebody is having a shower next door you think it is in you room. I don't really recommend the area either as on several occaisons comments were made by groups of men passing in cars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: T.BM
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for four nights at the end of October and must say it is one of the best hotels I have come across. It is very modern and clean cut with little charm of character if thats what you like. What I couldn't get over about this hotel is how clean it is - absolutley spotless!! The rooms are very well equipped and quiet so we got a good nights sleep everynight (as the hotel is in a peaceful residential area). You will need to use the metro to get around as it is quite a bit from the city but there is a metro station around the corner called 'Selva de Mar' (it's on the yellow line and will bring you directly to Passeig de Gracia metro stop, which is a stroll from Placa Catalunya - heart of the city!) Didn't have much interaction with the staff but they seemed a little bit distant. I would not recommend eating breakfast in this hotel - it's a rip-off! Instead exit the hotel and go right, after 200 m there is a huge shopping centre 'Diagonal Mar' which has loads of little cafes and restaurants (and very good clothes shops!). I would say that this hotel is perfect if your looking for somewhere really peaceful and relaxing as we found the bar and restaurant a bit too quiet for our liking. All in all, had a great stay in this hotel, loved Barcelona but please be warned watch your wallet, bag, camera etc etc - pickpockets are everywhere ...you have been warned!!!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: maccorq
Reviews.Content: a group of 5 of us stayed at the Vincci Maritimo in may 2005, and I have to say I really loved it. It was really clean, and very modern, and a real bargain at £60 a night. I couldn't fault it to be honest, the staff spoke excellent english and were extremely helpful, and it was situated almost right beside a metro stop. the only disadvantage is that breakfast wasn't included in our rate, and was quite pricey, but with a large shopping centre full of cafes just around the corner, we didn't go hungry! we have recommended the hotel to 3 couples since, who all equally loved it. it really does look like the internet photos!

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing!! Please read before you book.”
Reviews.Author: KawDenmark
Reviews.Content: We ordered a double room, and got a room with 2 beds pushed together. No other option available. In the description of the hotel it says free ADSL, but that only works if you have a Windows operated laptop. Otherwise it's 9€ an hour. The floor in the room was not cleaned during our 11 night stay. Only the bathroom floor was cleaned.
