It said cable tv in the description of the hotel, but there were only 2 channels to watch in english - cnn and eurosport. The rest was spanish versions of cable channels. NOTE: The aircondition in the room only works when you are in the room. That means when you go home during siesta, when the city is the most hot, you get home to a room that is extremely hot, and takes hours to cool down. LS, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way, but cheap”
Reviews.Author: COOMBSY
Reviews.Content: A bit out of the centre, but very near the tube station, nothing nearby except a few local shops and the Diagonal Mar shopping centre, the nearby beach was very uninviting. Aspires to "designer" hotel, but isn't. As other reviews have said, you can hear every door closing and people walking down the corridors etc. Why they can't have soundproofed the place is beyond me. But at £50 a night it's cheap enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -but you need to DIY your own tourist information !”
Reviews.Author: Hermissa
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are lovely - well equipped - but only 1 English speaking channell CNN. Hotel staff were not very helpful and their English was very - very poor. They had no information available ref tourism and when I asked for directions to the nearest Metro station which was 100 meters away then sent me in the wrong direction completely - getting us lost ! The signage for the Metro is non-existent !! You take a left out of the hotel walk about 100 meters and turn right up the side of a building being renovated - looks like a building site - the metro is at the back of this area - brilliant service into the centre of the city - very cheap and quick - but only if you find the station ! The area looks dodgy - but isnt - we had no problems wandering around - no groups of youths - mainly elderely residents and families. hotel for the quality is very good value - but get your bearings otherwise you will spend a lot of time wandering in circles - Only other complaints are the cost of taxis to/from the airport 30-35 euros - which in my opinion is too expensive - the guidebooks sasy 20/25 euros (must only apply if you know the taxi driver !!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, not where they advertise”
Reviews.Author: zorroazul
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous, spacious roooms, and unbelievable bathrooms. Staff was friendly and attentive, food was as expected in Spain nothing short of GREAT. Minor drawback is no pool, and the real issue here is that it is NOT located near paseo maritimo. It is in a run down neighborhood with absolutely nothing around, major bait and switch. I booked based on the name, and it is a 10 Euro cab ride away, which is not much of a problem except on a weekend when it is IMPOSSIBLE to get a cab in Barcelona, I am talking about 1 hour wait. So if you are looking for a nice hotel NEAR Paseo Maritimo, this is it. But do not get fooled by the name like I was.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stylish, just a few minor flaws!”
Reviews.Author: Lolo737
Reviews.Content: I visited the Vincci Maritimo for 10 days in June and overall my review is positive, i'd just like to mention a few probs. Generally any visit to reception will take a while. There will be a lot of standing with the phone to an ear in silence....Eyes will not be raised from the paperwork being examined until an uncomfortable amount of time has passed. If the phone rings at any point expect that enquiry to be dealt with first! Despite the fact I had booked a double room and then followed up my booking with an email direct to the hotel to make sure I received a double room.....guess what! Twin beds!! I went straight back to reception and a nice guy (Claudio, I think) was apologetic but as the hotel was fully booked I was told i'd be moved the next day. I could live with this although it was disappointingly predictable. Unfortunately when I went back the next day the man I spoke to was sooo rude!! He indicated sneeringly (with a shrug) that I had booked a double and that just means two people to them - they just allocate a room with two beds, whatever is available!! I had to explain in a busy reception that that was not acceptable and that I had the choice of a twin or a double room in a number of hotels but I picked a double in theirs. We got changed. Next prob - Sound proofing!! Between rooms its fine but the doors to the corridor appear to be paper thin! A couple of times at night I actually got a fright because the voices in the corridor seemed so close!! I too was woken by the same noisy party people coming home as the previous poster! And whats with all the door slamming at all times of day and night!! Despite these things I would definitely stay again. It's a great-looking hotel and the rooms are clean and comfortable (our maid was excellent) Bathroom is nice and the shower is fan-tastic, me and my boyfriend are feeling a bit hard done by in our shower at home now!! The location is great - round the corner from the metro (altho the streets being dug up at the mo) and its about a 10 minute walk to the beach (our main reason for picking it). Its only 4 stops to the Olympic village area with loads of restaurants but I would recommend staying on the 8 stops to Passeig de Gracia - which is a really nice wide street good for a wander day and night. This is the street with the Gaudi buildings Casa Mila and Casa Batllo and these are a must see but its also a much nicer area than Las Ramblas at night. Las Ramblas....lets be honest.... is a dump. It has cafes and it has newsagent stands in abundance....and thats it. Some street performers/living statues are pretty cool and there are some interesting side streets off it but Las Ramblas itself is nothing to see. That said - The fruit market off it has some amazing prices for amazing delicious fruit - maybe I'm being a bit harsh. The area around the hotel seemed safe and is mostly residential. There are some amazing modern apartment buildings around. Its a block away from a nice modern shopping centre with many options for breakfast, lunch and dinner(if need be) as well as some great shops. Also a fab supermarket for snacks/drinks for the beach....The supermarket is the only place we got a smile or a please or thankyou with the service! Anyway...back to the hotel....In summary, I completely agree with the previous poster - it's a stylish, clean and comfortable hotel in a convenient location. The rating I have given it is based on the location and the overall feel of the room. Ps. Taxi drivers generally didnt know the hotel. Taking a piece of paper with the address on it out with you might be a good idea. A spanish pal gave me a useful phrase which you pronounce - 'Ah laddo day' meaning 'beside/next to' so when I got a taxi driver who didnt know I said 'Ah laddo day Diagonal Mar' which is the name of the shopping centre it's next to. This got us home!

Reviews.Title: “Style over content”
Reviews.Author: douliou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vinnci Maritimo for 9 nights. It's a great-looking hotel - very modern and minimalist design throughout. The rooms are very clean and comfortable (air con is great - we found it a life-saver!), bathroom is very big compared to the size of the room itself. All the staff spoke excellent English. The location is great - as most people have said in other reviews, it's a minute's walk from the nearest metro station. There's also a tram stop very nearby which also takes you to Port Olympico - you get a nice cruise down the Avenue Diagonal and a great view of Torre Agbar. You can use your T-10 or T-dia ticket on the trams. This tram also takes you directly to the entrance of the zoo (which is well worth a visit). The area is very safe as it's mostly residential. If you don't want to pay 15 Euros for breakfast - you can get coffee and pastries for 2 for about 5 Euros at the fnac cafe in the shopping mall down the road. Also, if you're on a budget - you can get dinner/lunches very cheaply in one of the food court restuarants - not very cultural but it is cheaper!! You're also really close to the Poblenou area, a new up-and-coming-area, where there are lots of great cafes and restuarants. It feels like "real" Barcelona i.e. it's where Barcelonese go to hang out. In summary, you can't fault the location for ease of getting to the city centre, safety and the convenience of local amenities. So that's all the good stuff - so here's the negative.... One review mentioned the noise - and we found that to be a real problem. The first 3 nights, we were woken up at 2-3 am by some party animals arriving back. We could also hear people entering their rooms not just next door but a couple of rooms down!! So I would say that if you're in Barcelona for the nightlife, have some consideration when you return and if you're an early bird, bring some ear plugs!! Another review mentioned that their "double" room consisted of two single beds pushed together. We had the same "double" room arrangement which was not ideal - they didn't even make up the bed as a double! We also had a problem with room service - first of all, we couldn't find the phone number, any phone numbers in fact! So I had to go down to reception to ask for the number. When I called Room Service, I was asked to call back in 10 minutes because the kitchen was closed - couldn't they have taken my order then, for the sake of 10 minutes? Anyway, finally ordered and was told that it would arrive in 20 minutes. A whole 45 minutes later, it arrived!! When it was delivered - it seemed that we should have been more patient because the waitress had another five meals to deliver! Also, when I went down to the outside bar area around mid-afternoon one day, hoping for a drink of some sort, I couldn't find anybody to ask for one - there was no-one at the bar and I couldn't get the attention of the staff in the adjacent restaurant. I got the feeling that they felt the bar was nothing to do with them and so left me to it. I gave up after a while. I called this review "Style over content" - and it's because although the hotel looks very smart and stylish, we felt that the service didn't meet up to image. Now you may think that we're being harsh for the sake of room service and not being able to order a drink, but in a 4-star hotel - you do expect a certain level of service and we felt that we didn't get it in this hotel. I think that if they put less effort into how it looks and more into the service, it would greatly improve the whole experience. Also, our criticisms are based on a stay that is probably a lot longer than most guests so we had more time to "test" the service. I also think the hotel is geared towards short visits and business visitors rather than longer stays like ours - which may be why we haven't been as enamoured with it as other guests. In summary - it's a stylish, clean and comfortable hotel in a very convenient location. The service - or more specifically, the availability of service just lets it down.

Reviews.Title: “Vincci Maritimo a very pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: coriander
Reviews.Content: There's not much I can add after the last thorough review. Vincci Maritimo is in an up & coming area outside of central Barcelona, meaning there's both interesting architecture and a shopping center nearby, as well as run-down apartment buildings. The hotel is very nice, the beds comfortable (wish we'd noticed the pillow menu earlier!), the rooms & bathrooms modern and clean. Also has powerful AC and windows that open to the outside - very important in the hot summer months. We're glad that we took a taxi to the hotel from La Rambla after flying in (we took the bus to La Rambla). Cost about 9 euros, and we would have gotten lost finding our way from the metro stop (lots of construction). Next day it was no problem using the metro once we understand the layout of the neighborhood. We enjoyed our stay very much. It's always nice to stay closer to the center, but with the cost of hotels so high, this gave us a reasonable deal with no extreme hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from Barcelona and stayed in this Hotel. I booked it last August and got a good deal - £50 per night for a double room. I agree with all the good reviews - hotel is modern, clean and staff are friendly. Coming out at the metro was a bit of a shock as it seemed to be a building site. Don't worry - just follow the the path round and you will come out on the street where the Hotel is located. The only concern I had about this hotel was its lack of sound proofing. We were on the first floor and could hear light switches being turned on etc people moving about and the traffic outside in the street. If a light sleeper like me bring ear plugs!. Despite the noise I would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: Bernard_Blink
Reviews.Content: We had originally planned to stay somewhere else but finances dictated I find somewhere a little less expensive. And what a bargain this turned out to be! I booked it online via an agency and it worked out as about £70 a night for two. It's a bit corporate - there were a few conferences going on - but hey, if you're going to Barcelona to hang about the hotel you must be mad!! The Metro was a two minute walk and a 4 day travel card cost 16 euros. It takes about 10 minutes to get to Jaime I which is the station between Barri Gotic and La Ribera (5 minute stroll to La Rambla through some of the best streets you will ever see) and your ticket will get you everywhere you could want to go. It meant we actually got off our backsides and saw a bit more of Barcelona than the tourist hotspots and managed to get our bearings a lot quicker. And what to see!! I won't go on but it's just so wonderful! Just go explore everywhere - you won't be disappointed. Do find time to check out Gimlet in La Ribera - a cocktail bar with no menu because the girl working there knows how to make them all!! And I'm not talking some poseur bar - just an old fashioned cherry wood polished bar, mellow music, chilled out type place... Anyway - back to the hotel. Surprisingly it was actually quite nice to get out of the centre and back to the hotel. It's situated in a residential/office area with a big shopping centre round the corner and a certain amount of building work going on. But it wasn't a problem. The Metro runs until 2 at the weekend (12 in the week) but a taxi only costs 7-8 euros if you're later than that. Some drivers aren't sure where it is so we just asked to get dropped of at the Metro station (makes things much simpler)which is Salva de Mar. So - the hotel wasn't spectacular but it was very reasonable, very clean, very modern and the staff were very helpful and professional. The room was spacious, bed comfy and the shower great! The breakfast was good, too. I would recommend this hotel to any one staying in Barcelona but do bear in mind I'm not a fusspot and if you're after something really special this probably isn't the place for you. But if you want value for money and absolutely nothing to complain about then go. Would I stay here again? Definitely - unless I win the lottery, of course..!

Reviews.Title: “A calming and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveladdict40
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel seemed to be a little problematic for the taxi drvier to find, we eventually arrived. Despite this minor hiccup, it was a great location, just a short metro journey away from the city centre, but also close to the sea and if you were feeling energetic a very nice walk along the sea front and beaches to where the Olympic Village is located. Our room overlooked the public square and was just as it had been shown on the website very zen style and pretty quiet. We stayed for a total of three nights to celebrate my birthday and introduce my husband to the city as he had never visited before. We had a great stay and would love to return. Whilst we did not dine in the restaurant,we did have breakfast and can recommend it, but if you fill up too much at the start of the day you can miss out on the delights of lunchtime, the menu del dia at many places is good value, we spent our first lunchtime at Les Quinze Nits in Placa Reial, which was great but very busy in the evenings. Also recommend La Fonda even if you have to queue, the food was pretty inexpensive and very tasty. The sights of the city of Barcelona were as fantastic as ever, Casa Batillo and Casa Mila, both worth a visit as well as the Gothic Cathedral and just walking down the Ramblas. All in all this hotel was a great calming and relaxing environment and a great antedote to the hustle and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “gotta love the maritimo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfrriend stayed here for five nights for his twenty first birthday, and absolutely loved it.very easy access to the metro, which provides transport all accross the city, leading to many of the popular sights including the segrada familia and parc ruel. The hotel staff were very polite and friendly, and the rooms were beautiful, very modern with a fantastic shower and bathroom. We had no problems at all. The park next door was fantastic, all local residents resided there, and it had a relaxing and friendly atmosphere. We loved our stay in Barcelona. And the vinnci made our stay relaxing and very enjoyable. thanks for a brilliant room!!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL AND SUPERB VFM (£52 PER NIGHT OR £74 WITH BREAKFAST)!”
Reviews.Author: DavidWiltshire
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here recently and agree with the many favourable comments by others. Diagaonal Mar is full of newly designed buildings and appears to be an up and coming area. Some may consider it a bit sterile but you have Barca centre for the feel and bustle of the old town. Yes you have to get the metro (efficient/clean) into town but that's all part of the experience. Hotel was minimalist,clean and functional with helpful staff. We had room 418 which overlooked a communial area in front of the hotel which consisted of a small football pitch, table tennis tables etc. No noise from children etc. Our room also had good lighting, shower and toiletries. Beds were really comfy, all very nicely designed. Shopping centre a few mins away is worth a wonder (Zara, huge supermarket, perfume shops, eateries (Dunkin Donuts, Ben & Jerrys etc). Better to vist the real thing - Mango restaurant right outside the complex. Menu del dia - 8 euros! (gnocchi in pesto sauce, fish cutlets with a mixed salad, individual tarte tartin and a 1/4 litre of wine) Superb value and service. That's around £6, much less than 2 Big Mac meals! Many other places similar, no wonder why the spanish eat out more than other europeans. Why can't we do this in England? I would hire some bikes to wander around the sea front and other communal areas, they are well designed and marked out - running tracks, fitness trails, sports centre near by. You can walk/cycle directly to port Vell from the hotel (40 mins walk) and just catch the metro back. If you have kids they can climb various contraptions on the beach. Worth popping into the Hotel Arts (massive copper fish sculpture outside) just to see how the other half live. Wander around the pool area, all very swish. Make sure you look smart as not to attract too much attention from all the Armani clad staff. I did check the room price and was told they start at £350 per night! Vincci Maratimo breakfast was excellent (15 euros), fresh juices, pastries, eggs, bacon, sausages, good rolls, so approx £70 for 2 which is superb value for a 4 star hotel. If you want to skip breakfast just copy the locals and pop into any bars for excellent coffee, pastries, tortilla etc, around 3-4 euros each! Hotel bar reasonably priced with comfy seats and sofas, welcomed after being on your feet all day. Free PC internet access as well! Must also recommend La Fonda restaurant c/dels escudellers) at the sea end of Rambla. Again the set menu 9 euros (e.g. chick pea/spinach soup, fried fish and veg, house flan, and wine/coffee) always packed with locals. Been there 5 times never hard a bad experience. We'll pop back again in the summer.Just ENJOY Barcelona but remember to keep you bags/wallets safe!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bubblelush1
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel which we would highly recommend. The rooms were great with lovely king size beds (we were asked if we wanted a double and were given just that) The receptionists were very helpful and friendly and the late check out (12 noon) was also good as we were also able to leave our bags till our evening flight. The location is 2 mins walk from the nearest Metro (Salva De Mar) which is only 10 mins and 5 stops from the heart of Barcelona. The shopping mall is less than 5 mins walk away from the hotel and has plenty of shops, a supermarket and an abundance of places to eat. Would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good value of money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very near the metro station. The hotel is a bit noise maybe due to the sound - proofing is not good. You can hear your neighour go in and out as well as walk by your room. The hotel is new and fitting out is good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern hotel in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean, modern, new hotel. Staff is extremely friendly. The atmosphere is very welcoming. It is in a nice new area, facing the park and beyond the park are the beaches. Subway station is 50m away (L4-Selva de Mar) and a shopping center is about 5 min walking away. With subway it is easy to reach the city center 12-15mins Line4 to Placa Catalunya. Even a nice walk along the beach is only about 30 min to Porto Olimpico where there are a great nubmer of restaurants, bars and discotheks (also a Casino de Barcelona). Rooms are clean, new. The bathroom is big, the shower is a nice treat (it feels like showering in the rain). Here is the exact position of the hotel (for those who like satelite images on Google Earth) longitude 2.21212940811673 latitude 41.40755462473369 Word of advise for those travelling with lots of heavy bags: do not travel with bus/subway with the bags when coming/going to airport. Subway stations do not have elevators and most of them do not have escalators either. The bus takes only about 60 people, the rest have to wait for the next bus (approx 12min).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LIZcc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 3rd - 7th January.The rooms were excellant ,very clean with fresh towels every day.Double beds were huge a little bit on the firm side but ok.I don't normally sleep well in hotels because of noise but i slept like a log all night The staff were helpful and friendly, The bar and restaraunt were very quiet but it was january. The hotel is on the outskirts of Barcelona centre but the metro is very close and very efficient. There is a brilliant shopping centre a short walk from the hotel (turn right out the hotel door) great shops and plenty of restaraunts. We took the train and metro from the airport but a taxi on the way back cost 33euros and was quicker and less stressful if you don't speak or read spanish. I would recommend this hotel and would defintely go back. Barcelona is a fantastic city to visit some of it is a bit hilly so wear comfortable shoes as the cobble streets are a killer on the feet. HAVE FUN IN BARCELONA!!!

Reviews.Title: “Luv it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. 3 min walk away from the metro and 10 min away from the city center by metro. luv the big shopping center next to it. The Room Look exactly like the pictures and virtual tour which showed in expedia. Will deff come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in the space of a week. Went one weekend and was so happy with the hotel went back the following weekend! Pictures don’t do the rooms justice, and the showers, oohhh yeah! Staff are very friendly and helpful both times I was there, don’t know why people say they are rude and unhelpful, maybe those guests were rude themselves? You can get some great deals on this hotel online, so have a shop about. Will be going back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having agonised over which hotel to book for my boyfriend's fortieth birthday surprise, I finally chose the Vinnci Maritimo, which bills itself as a contemporary four star hotel. Starting with the positive, it has a good location, is close to the metro and cheap and painless to get into the city centre. The rooms are exactly as shown in the photos - cool and trendy. The reality however, is that the modern, minimalist look does make the rooms a little stark and unwelcoming. My real gripe though, is with the hotel facilities. In every hotel I have ever stayed in, from a 2 to 5 star, I have always had the use of an iron and ironing board. Not at the Vinnci Maritimo! 'It is not a service we offer' said the Duty Manager when I complained. If we wanted our clothes ironed, we would have to pay housekeeping to iron them for us. This would take 24 hours for them to do. Considering we were only staying for two nights, this was far from ideal. The staff were disinterested and unhelpful regarding our complaint and as a result we cancelled our second night's stay and moved five minutes down the road to the four star Barcelona Princess. What a difference! Fabulous rooms that have to be seen to be believed, free mini bar, heated roof top pool, friendly, helpful staff, two minutes to the metro and cheaper than the Maritimo! On balance the Princess is probably the best hotel I have stayed in. I am just disappointed I did not book the Princess originally and save myself the stress and inconvenience brought about by our short stay at the Maritimo!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JollyHollidayer
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind staying out of town, then this is the hotel for you. However, I must agree with some of the recent reviews that state that this is a bit of a dodgy area. If you keep your wits about you though, you'll be fine. The hotel itself was very modern and comfortable. The rooms are lovely - ultra trendy bathrooms - and the beds are huge. The staff are pleasant enough, but not overly helpful. What we did find a bit strange though was that the hotel bar always seemed to be closed, even when we returned early one night at 10:30pm!! Barcelona is a fantastic city and we will definately return. Not sure that we would stay at the Maritimo again, purely down to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Vincii Maritimo great hotel, lousy service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were guests at the Vincci in early May, and found the hotel to be quite modern and the location was perfect for us. While it was outside of the center of the city, it was preferable to a hotel in the very noisy tourist areas. It was lovely to return to the hotel after a busy day and be able to look forward to a peaceful night's sleep. Public transportation is excellent, with the tram, metro, and buses available within a few block radius of the hotel. At no time did we ever feel unsafe coming to and from the hotel even at night. On the negative side: The hotel staff was cool at best and we had problems getting clean towels each day. The hotel advertises that it has contour pillows and even has a card in the room saying so, yet when I requested one I was told by the person at the front desk in a very arrogant manner that "contour pillows aren't available at this hotel, madame." The buffet breakfast in the hotel restaurant is adequate, but don't have dinner there. It is horribly overpriced and the food isn't good at all. The same 5 tired entrees are offered each night and everything tasted as though it was cooked elsewhere and reheated.

Reviews.Title: “Class!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin&JenAhern
Reviews.Content: Took my fiance for her 30th Birthday due to reviews read on this site. As has been said in earlier reviews 1st rate hotel, with great axcess to the tube. All our travel was done on the tube which is clean and efficient (but lady's watch your handbags!!!! saw the city urchins at work one evening on the way home, gone in a flash with a tourists bag.) If you dont want to stay near the centre, (which I would'nt dream off personally) this IS the place to stay. Only a brief tube ride into town, even shorter if you get off at Barcelonetta and walk along the harbour to the bottom of Ramblas which is lovely. All in all great clean, safe, hotel with excellent staff, in a cracking quiet area overlooking a park and in the distance the sea. Just the ticket for a special occasion! Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel ... dodgy location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is great; ultra-modern, stylish and comfortable. Be warned though, the surrounding area is very unsafe at night. My partner and I were mugged just round the corner from the hotel. Three local youths approached us and stole my girlfriend's bag from her hand as we walked down the street. I gave chase and managed to retrieve the bag but it was a very unpleasant incident. I don't think the 3 muggers were expecting to be chased and confronted by a large aggressive Yorkshireman but it did the trick. The incident was compounded further by the hotel's lack of interest in our well-being and refusal to call the police. This left a bad taste in the mouth as the receptionist told us that we should count ourselves 'lucky' and that some residents had been attacked on the metro and left with nothing. A wonderful advert for customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: CiaraB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money. The rooms are modern, bright and clean. The staff are very good and speak excellent english. The location of the hotel is a bit out of the way, but its only a 2min walk to the metro. It's also a 2 min walk to the light rail which goes to the Olympic area by the beach. The suburb is a bit drab but that wasn't a drawback really. Also, there's a new shopping centre about 2 min walk from the hotel. Would definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Vincci Maritimo Barcelona
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Llull 340 | Esquina Selva de Mar, 08019 Barcelona, Spain
